definition: (of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest

sentences.english: It is storied that Mahasthamaprapta preached in Putuo Mount of Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 相传其显灵说法的道场在浙江普陀山。

sentences.english: However, she did report a vision of Jesus at Mount Olivet with three Apostles.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在橄榄山，她和三个使徒宣称看到耶稣显灵。

sentences.english: The Landau luck, Mark and Sandra were convinced, had finally shifted.
sentences.chinese: “兰朵好运”在马克和桑德拉身上再次等到显灵。

sentences.english: It was a strange-looking board, covered with letters and symbols.
sentences.chinese: 这个显灵板看上去很怪，上面有字母和符号。

sentences.english: The Ouija Board is used to contact spirits or entities.
sentences.chinese: 显灵板是用来联系灵界的鬼魂。

sentences.english: A king, and appeared to help feed had slain all hidden bow.
sentences.chinese: 灵猫显灵助君王，徒曾杀孽弓尽藏。

sentences.english: Sacrament means mystery, relating to the divine presence.
sentences.chinese: 圣礼意味着神秘，与神的显灵有关。

definition: lit. to ascend to heaven/to die
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
to burn incense and worship Buddha
to descend to the world (of immortals)
